 To run the pre-commit checks locally, you can follow below steps: 1. Ensure that default python is python3. In sonic-mgmt docker container, default python is python2. You can run the check by activating the python3 virtual environment in sonic-mgmt docker container or outside of sonic-mgmt docker container. 2. Ensure that the `pre-commit` package is installed: ``` sudo pip install pre-commit ``` 3. Go to repository root folder 4. Install the pre-commit hooks: ``` pre-commit install ``` 5. Use pre-commit to check staged file: ``` pre-commit ``` 6. Alternatively, you can check committed files using: ``` pre-commit run --from-ref --to-ref ```

Let me verify the PR with cisco platform.

Pushed another commit to limit the change to Mellanox only, and also run the test on multiple platforms.
On Cisco testbed.
```

collected 5 items 

pfcwd/test_pfcwd_function.py::TestPfcwdFunc::test_pfcwd_actions[str3-8111-05] ^H ^HPASSED [ 20%]

```

The change is also verified on a SN4700 testbed with Mellanox leaf fanout.

Suggest to only test minor number of ports below confident level to save more time

> > Suggest to only test minor number of ports below confident level to save more time
> 
> @xwjiang-ms , The case takes about 20 minutes by design, if it is still too much for smoke test, I prefer to set the default level to debug. Shall we modify it now, or we can merge the PR first, and check the current smoke's result, then make the decision, thanks.

@lipxu I think we can modify it now, because smoke test is not stress test and shouldn't play this role

> > > Suggest to only test minor number of ports below confident level to save more time
> > 
> > 
> > @xwjiang-ms , The case takes about 20 minutes by design, if it is still too much for smoke test, I prefer to set the default level to debug. Shall we modify it now, or we can merge the PR first, and check the current smoke's result, then make the decision, thanks.
> 
> @lipxu I think we can modify it now, because smoke test is not stress test and shouldn't play this role

Modified default level to debug, please review again, thanks

hi @xwjiang-ms I maybe wrong, I remember confident is low band of iteration, that's not true?

> hi @xwjiang-ms I maybe wrong, I remember confident is low band of iteration, that's not true?

@StormLiangMS In most of tests, debug < basic < confident < thorough < diagnose, and if we do not define completeness_level, we will use basic by default
Checked again and set the return level to basic in get_completeness_level_metadata

> > hi @xwjiang-ms I maybe wrong, I remember confident is low band of iteration, that's not true?
> 
> @StormLiangMS In most of tests, debug < basic < confident < thorough < diagnose, and if we do not define completeness_level, we will use basic by default

Hi, @xwjiang-ms , is there a recommended running time range for each case at these level, I mean, for each level, what is the expected running time per case?

> > > hi @xwjiang-ms I maybe wrong, I remember confident is low band of iteration, that's not true?
> > 
> > 
> > @StormLiangMS In most of tests, debug < basic < confident < thorough < diagnose, and if we do not define completeness_level, we will use basic by default
> 
> Hi, @xwjiang-ms , is there a recommended running time range for each case at these level, I mean, for each level, what is the expected running time per case?

Currently we do not have such recommended running time range

Good suggestion! Maybe we can add some checks in Pre_test Static Analysis.

There's a comment in the PR that fixed these copp tests (https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/12836) from the author indicating that 7050cx3 is still expected to fail. After discussion with @StormLiangMS we decided to add the xfail back in for those platforms

Please verify it does and if so, This PR is ready from my part (and needs to be backported to 202311/202405 as well).

Ensure that the `pre-commit` package is installed: ``` sudo pip install pre-commit ``` 3. Go to repository root folder 4. Install the pre-commit hooks: ``` pre-commit install ``` 5. Use pre-commit to check staged file: ``` pre-commit ``` 6. Alternatively, you can check committed files using: ``` pre-commit run --from-ref --to-ref ```

The verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts is defined in helper files of PFC testcases for both single ASIC and multidut scenario. 

The verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts is defined in tests/common/snappi_tests/traffic_generation.py is ONLY one calling get_lossless_buffer_size.

get_lossless_buffer_size is using config_facts to determine the buffer-size.
```
config_facts = host_ans.config_facts(host=host_ans.hostname,
 source="running")['ansible_facts']
```
However, if it is multi-asic platform, the config_facts will not return ingress_lossless profile as it is stored in config_facts as nested dictionary with asic as one of the key.

```
config_facts = host_ans.config_facts(host=duthost1.hostname,
 source="running", namespace=asic_value)['ansible_facts']
```

Proposed solution:
Change needs to be in multidut PFC testcase helper files to send right asic value to verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts(which has default asic_value set to NONE). If asic_value is passed to verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts, it will call get_lossless_buffer_size (which has default asic_value also set to NONE) with right asic_value.

Will discuss this in the community before making the changes.

Thanks,
-A

> The verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts is defined in helper files of PFC testcases for both single ASIC and multidut scenario.
>

> 
> get_lossless_buffer_size is using config_facts to determine the buffer-size.
> 
> ```
> config_facts = host_ans.config_facts(host=host_ans.hostname,
> source="running")['ansible_facts']
> ```
> 
> However, if it is multi-asic platform, the config_facts will not return ingress_lossless profile as it is stored in config_facts as nested dictionary with asic as one of the key.
> 
> ```
> config_facts = host_ans.config_facts(host=duthost1.hostname,
> source="running", namespace=asic_value)['ansible_facts']
> ```

If asic_value is passed to verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts, it will call get_lossless_buffer_size (which has default asic_value also set to NONE) with right asic_value.
> 
> Will discuss this in the community before making the changes.
> 
> Thanks, -A

+## Objectives of CLI Test Cases

+

+| | **Test Case** | **Intention** | **Comments** |

+| ---------- | ---------- | ---------------------------------------- | ---------- |

+| 1.1 | Check DPU Status | To verify the DPU Status shown in the cli | |

+| 1.2 | Check platform voltage | To verify the Voltage sensor values and and functionality of alarm by changing the threshold values | |

+| 1.3 | Check platform temperature | To Verify the Temperature sensor values and functionality of alarm by changing the threshold values | |

+| 1.4 | Check DPU console | To Verify console access for all DPUs | |

+| 1.5 | Check midplane ip address between NPU and DPU | To Verify PCIe interface created between NPU and DPU according to bus number | |

+| 1.6 | Check DPU shutdown and power up individually | To Verify one DPU shutdown and other DPUs in same as well in other sleds are up | |
